actions.committee: Senate Committee on Rules and Administration
actions.text: Referred to Senate Committee on Rules and Administration.

official_title: A bill to establish office accounts for Senators, to require public disclosure of expenditures from such accounts.

summary.text: Requires the Secretary of the Senate to establish an office account for each Senator to defray the expenses of conducting official business. Establishes the maximum amount which may be paid from a Senator's office account for any calendar year. Prohibits the expenditure of funds from such account for personal services, or office furnishings or equipment. Requires the Secretary to maintain records of all such accounts and make them available for public inspection. Sets forth a procedure for requesting office furniture and equipment through the General Services Administration.

titles.title: A bill to establish office accounts for Senators, to require public disclosure of expenditures from such accounts.
